stepAnswer: $$65$$ mph for Carina and $$50$$ mph for her brother
stepTitle: Carina is driving from her home in Anaheim to Berkeley on the same day her brother is driving from Berkeley to Anaheim, so they decide to meet for lunch along the way in Buttonwillow. The distance from Anaheim to Berkeley is $$395$$ miles. It takes Carina three hours to get to Buttonwillow, while her brother drives four hours to get there. Carina’s average speed is $$15$$ miles per hour faster than her brother’s average speed. Find Carina’s and her brother’s average speeds.
answerLatex: $$65$$ mph for Carina and $$50$$ mph for her brother
choices: $$65$$ mph for Carina and $$50$$ mph for her brother
$$80$$ mph for Carina and $$45$$ mph for her brother
$$60$$ mph for Carina and $$55$$ mph for her brother
